responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain automated test frameworks and suites using Java-based frameworks such as JUnit, TestNG.
Collaborate closely with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
Implement and execute test plans and test cases to ensure comprehensive test coverage.
Perform API testing using tools like REST Assured to validate data integrity and functionality of backend services.
Define requirements and propose solutions to streamline the testing process with a strong commitment to ownership.
Engage in in-depth technical dialogues with the engineering team, comprehend software workflows and use cases, and ensure the system's testability.
Deliver timely and precise updates on testing status and quality metrics to stakeholders throughout all testing phases.
Compile Quality outcomes summary upon project completion.
Advocate for superior software testing practices within the team and foster adoption across the organization.
qualifications: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to effectively debug and resolve complex technical issues.
Ability to grasp issues quickly and make educated, critical judgment in the absence of complete requirements.
Adaptability to thrive in fast-paced environments with frequent context switching.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Java.
Ability to abstract technical details and effectively communicate to audiences at different levels.
Proficient at balancing multiple efforts simultaneously and meeting strict deadlines.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed focus primarily on software testing, particularly automated testing using Java-based frameworks like JUnit and TestNG. The responsibilities include designing and maintaining test frameworks, collaborating with software engineers and stakeholders, performing API testing, and advocating for superior software testing practices. The skills required include strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, proficiency in Java, and the ability to communicate technical details effectively.

There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on software testing and quality assurance, which does not inherently involve GenAI or LLMs unless explicitly stated or implied through specific tasks related to AI model testing or development, which is not the case here.
